meanings.definition: The action of attacking or assertively rejecting cherished beliefs or institutions.
meanings.sent1: The iconoclasm of the protestors led to the removal of the controversial statue.
meanings.sent2: Her iconoclasm towards outdated traditions made her stand out in the community.
meanings.sent3: The iconoclasm of the children towards eating vegetables was met with playful resistance.
meanings.sent4: His iconoclasm towards conformity was like a wrecking ball to societal norms.
meanings.sent5: The iconoclasm of the artist transformed the art world with bold new ideas.

meanings.definition: A person who attacks or criticizes traditional or widely accepted beliefs.
meanings.sent1: She was known as an iconoclasm for her fearless criticism of the government.
meanings.sent2: The iconoclasm's speeches challenged the audience to question their long-held beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The iconoclasm's cat became famous for its outspoken opinions on catnip.
meanings.sent4: He was a true iconoclasm, shattering the illusions of the status quo.
meanings.sent5: The young iconoclasm inspired others to think outside the box with her radical ideas.
